dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Cashless border crossings are becoming a real trend in Central Asia, aren't they?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Cashless border crossings are becoming a real trend in Central Asia, aren't they?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely. I was just reading that Uzbekistan is considering letting Kazakh citizens enter using only their national ID cards.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely. I was just reading that Uzbekistan is considering letting Kazakh citizens enter using only their national I D cards.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Uzbekistan is considering a proposal to allow Kazakh citizens to enter the country using only their national ID cards.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it's for up to 30 days, which is, um, pretty generous window for travel or business.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it's for up to thirty days, which is, um, pretty generous window for travel or business.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The idea involves permitting entry for up to 30 days with internal identification documents.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and it would even apply to minors—kids under 16 could use those so-called kinder-passports.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and it would even apply to minors-kids under sixteen could use those so-called kinder-passports.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The initiative would also apply to minors, allowing children under 16 to cross the border using so-called kinder-passports " an informal term for travel documents issued to children.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Kinder-passports, that's such an informal but descriptive term. Makes it sound almost cute, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Kinder-passports, that's such an informal but descriptive term. Makes it sound almost cute, you know?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It does! But the National Security Committee is stressing that this is all still under discussion, nothing's official yet.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It does! But the National Security Committee is stressing that this is all still under discussion, nothing's official yet.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Authorities emphasize that the proposal is still under discussion and no official changes have been made yet. All suggestions are being evaluated, the National Security Committee (NSC) told reporters.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And they mentioned negotiations are expected over the next three months, so we're looking at a summer decision maybe?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they mentioned negotiations are expected over the next three months, so we're looking at a summer decision maybe?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Negotiations are expected to take place over the next three months.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Possibly. The main goal here seems to be boosting tourism and making travel easier for business and, uh, humanitarian reasons too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Possibly. The main goal here seems to be boosting tourism and making travel easier for business and, uh, humanitarian reasons too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The initiative aims to boost tourism, facilitate humanitarian and business travel, increase tourist flow, create jobs, and support small and medium-sized businesses in the tourism sector.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which makes sense—increased tourist flow usually means more jobs and support for small businesses in the sector.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which makes sense-increased tourist flow usually means more jobs and support for small businesses in the sector.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The initiative aims to boost tourism, facilitate humanitarian and business travel, increase tourist flow, create jobs, and support small and medium-sized businesses in the tourism sector.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And it's not like this is new territory for them; they did something similar with Kyrgyzstan last year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And it's not like this is new territory for them; they did something similar with Kyrgyzstan last year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A similar arrangement was introduced between Uzbekistan and Kyrgyzstan in 2023, allowing citizens of both countries to cross the border using ID cards.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, 2023, right? So they've got a model to work from. That probably smooths things out a bit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, twenty twenty three, right? So they've got a model to work from. That probably smooths things out a bit.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A similar arrangement was introduced between Uzbekistan and Kyrgyzstan in 2023, allowing citizens of both countries to cross the border using ID cards.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. And it's interesting—Kazakhstan is also talking about a visa-free regime with Turkmenistan, so regional mobility is really heating up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. And it's interesting-Kazakhstan is also talking about a visa-free regime with Turkmenistan, so regional mobility is really heating up.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier, Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs Aibek Kuantyrov announced that Kazakhstan is discussing the possibility of introducing a visa-free regime with Turkmenistan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It feels like Central Asia is slowly tearing down those old barriers, one agreement at a time.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It feels like Central Asia is slowly tearing down those old barriers, one agreement at a time.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely a step in the right direction for connectivity and, um, economic cooperation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely a step in the right direction for connectivity and, um, economic cooperation.
